segments.text: Good morning , Madam . What can I do for you ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I need to have some money transferred from the UK , from my company . It's kind of an emergency .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That shouldn't be a problem , Madam . I'm sure we can sort this out for you quickly .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That would be wonderful . The problem is I don't have an account with you . That is a problem , isn't it ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , to be honest , it will slow things down a little . But it's not a big problem . You can do it by T / T .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: T / T ? What on earth is that ! ? Sorry , but I've never heard of it . T / T ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It means ' telegraphic transfer ' . So , if you use this way it's fast and secure and can be done from anywhere , to anywhere in the world .
segments.speaker: S1
